image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: What did Nizam of Hyderabad gift as lavish wedding gift to Queen Elizabeth II?
item.description: In 1947, Princess Elizabeth received a stunning tiara and necklace from the Nizam of Hyderabad, crafted by Cartier and now valued at $88 million. The tiara, with detachable brooches, and the necklace adorned with diamonds, have become iconic royal pieces, currently worn by Queen Camilla following Queen Elizabeth II's passing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tripura breach: Dhaka summons Indian envoy
Namibia elects first female president, Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah
item.description: Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah has become Namibia's first female president, securing 57% of the vote and continuing the SWAPO party's 34-year rule. Her election signifies a momentous development in Namibian politics, despite challenges from the IPC, which plans to contest the election results, citing procedural issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Conspiracy theory behind Reid Hoffman considering leaving US is...; Elon Musk agrees
item.description: ​New York Times reported that Hoffman supported Kamala Harris and according to reports he told his friends that he was thinking of relocating to somewhere else because he thinks Trump would use his power to seek retribution against his political enemies. Conservative commentator Charlie Kirk asked on X why Reid Hoffman would flee the country if he did nothing wrong.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Asteroid nearly hits Earth, lights up Siberian sky before impact
item.description: A small asteroid, C0WEPC5, entered Earth's atmosphere and burned up over Siberia on December 4, 2024, producing a bright fireball. Detected just hours prior, it highlighted advancements in monitoring techniques. This marks the fourth imminent impactor detected this year, demonstrating improved observational capabilities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: FAA investigates American Airlines flight after emergency return to Chicago
item.description: The FAA is investigating an American Airlines flight that returned to Chicago O'Hare due to a potential electrical issue detected by an indicator light, which was later found to be a false alarm. Passengers resumed their journey on a replacement aircraft. The incident adds to a series of recent issues faced by the airline.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: CNN compares South Korea martial law with Trump's Capitol riots, slammed
item.description: ​"Donald Trump is about to be the president. Somebody who has said he wants to use the military to go after his own enemies," CNN White House correspondent MJ Lee said as she explained that the pictures coming from Seoul are very emotionally jarring for the folks in South Korea.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump Jr says as a father he understands Biden's pardon but...
item.description: "In his statement, Biden said the justice system has been infected by politics. Well, I agree..Biden thinks the DoJ was weaponized. It sounds like we have a bipartisan agreement on that. And we need Kash Patel in FBI to clean the house," Donald Trump Jr said as he also addressed the resistance Kash's nomination as the FBI director.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When South Korean first lady got embroiled in Dior bag controversy
item.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol apologizes on national television for the controversies involving his wife, Kim Keon-hee. He admits she should have conducted herself more appropriately but clarifies that most allegations are exaggerated. Yoon rejects an investigation call but ensures a committee will oversee her official duties.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Elon Musk react with 'I love Canada' after Trump's 51st state suggestion to Trudeau?
item.description: Elon Musk's 'I love Canada' T-shirt sparked false claims about his support for making Canada the 51st state of the US. The speculation arose after a dinner where Donald Trump jokingly suggested to Justin Trudeau that Canada should become a US state if it cannot manage its economy without ripping off the US to the tune of $100 billion.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Seoul under martial law: Massive protest erupt in Seoul, parliament passes resolution to lift declaration- top developments
item.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol declared emergency martial law, citing opposition parties' actions as threats to national security and constitutional order. He vowed to eliminate anti-state forces and normalize the nation. The opposition condemned the move as unconstitutional. Details on martial law enforcement were not specified, sparking further concerns amid escalating political tensions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese embassy urges citizens in S. Korea to exercise 'caution' after martial law
item.description: China's embassy in Seoul advised its citizens to exercise caution after South Korea's President Yoon Suk Yeol declared emergency martial law due to threats from North Korea's communist forces and political tensions over a budget bill. Yoon emphasized the need to protect the country and maintain regional peace and stability.

item.title: Ohio woman who inspired Trump's 'eating the...' remark jailed for a year for eating cat
item.description: Allexis T Ferrell, a 27-year-old woman from Ohio, was sentenced to a year in jail for killing and eating a cat. The incident was falsely attributed to a Haitian immigrant and was cited by Donald Trump in the presidential debate as Haitian immigrants eating pet cats and dogs became a major issue ahead of the election. Ferrell pleaded guilty to cruelty to animals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Disney Channel really shutting down? Here’s the truth
item.description: Disney Channel is shutting down in international markets like France, Spain, the UK, and Australia as part of Disney's strategy to focus on its streaming service, Disney+. However, there are no plans to discontinue Disney Channel in the US, ensuring its content remains available on traditional TV.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Karoline Leavitt praised Mike Pence in 2021 and then deleted two social media posts
item.description: Karoline Leavitt, 27, soon to be the youngest White House press secretary under President-elect Donald Trump, praised then-Vice President Mike Pence for certifying the 2020 election post-Capitol riots but later deleted her supportive posts and aligned with election deniers. She unsuccessfully ran for a New Hampshire congressional seat in 2022.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Beyond Trump’s 51st state joke: Would Canadian economy crash without US trade?
item.description: In 2018, when Trump proposed a 25% tariff on Canadian goods, the Canadian Prime Minister promptly boarded a plane to Florida to address the issue in person. The meeting, held at Trump’s Mar-a-Lago estate, was meant to avert economic disaster for Canada. What Trudeau likely didn’t expect was Trump’s candid observation: “If Canada can’t survive without ripping off the US, maybe it should just become our 51st state.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Serena Williams shuts trolls who claim she's bleaching her skin: 'I love who I am'
item.description: Serena Williams addressed rumors about bleaching her skin, clarifying she has not altered her skin color and loves being a Black woman. She said she does not judge anyone who lightens their skin but she loves how she looks and she never bleached her skin to appear fairer. The viral video that triggered the speculation was from her child's play at school where Serena said she had put on some makeup.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meghan Markle appoints herself CEO of her brand American Riviera Orchard because...
item.description: Meghan Markle has named herself CEO of her new lifestyle brand, American Riviera Orchard, after struggling to find a suitable candidate. Facing ongoing trademark issues and negotiations with Netflix, Markle intends to launch the brand and related Netflix projects by early 2025 amidst administrative hurdles and staffing challenges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Royal grandeur: Prince William and Kate Middleton host Qatar's Emir and his wife for a state visit to Britain
Fox News host says he wants to see Tulsi Gabbard surfing after RFK Jr's shirtless workout video
item.description: Fox News host Jesse Watters faced backlash after commenting on RFK Jr's shirtless workout video, saying he wanted to see similar content from female Trump picks like Linda McMahon and Tulsi Gabbard. Though Tulsi Gabbard is a surfer, Watters' remarks were criticized on social media, with users calling him a 'pervert'.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
